00037 template <class T>
00038 inline
00039 const T
00040 sc_min( const T& a, const T& b )
00041 {
00042     return ( ( a <= b ) ? a : b );
00043 }
00044 
00045 template <class T>
00046 inline
00047 const T
00048 sc_max( const T& a, const T& b )
00049 {
00050     return ( ( a >= b ) ? a : b );
00051 }
00052 
00053 template <class T>
00054 inline
00055 const T
00056 sc_abs( const T& a )
00057 {
00058     // return ( a >= 0 ? a : -a );
00059     // the code below is functionaly the same as the code above; the
00060     // difference is that the code below works for all arithmetic
00061     // SystemC datatypes.
00062     T z( a );
00063     z = 0;
00064     if( a >= z ) {
00065         return a;
00066     } else {
00067         T c( a );
00068         c = -a;
00069         return c;
00070     }
00071 }

00085 // token concatenation

00087   SC_CONCAT_HELPER_DEFERRED_( a, b )
00088 #define SC_CONCAT_HELPER_DEFERRED_( a, b ) \
00089   SC_CONCAT_HELPER_MORE_DEFERRED_( a,b )
00090 #define SC_CONCAT_HELPER_MORE_DEFERRED_( a, b ) \
00091   a ## b
00092 #define SC_CONCAT_UNDERSCORE_( a, b ) \
00093   SC_CONCAT_HELPER_( a, SC_CONCAT_HELPER_( _, b ) )

00099 /*
00100  *  These help debugging --
00101  *  -- the user can find out at which location in their source file a process calls wait.
00102  */
00103 
00104 #define SC_WAIT()                                       \
00105     ::sc_core::sc_set_location( __FILE__, __LINE__ );   \
00106     ::sc_core::wait();                                  \
00107     ::sc_core::sc_set_location( NULL, 0 )
00108 
00109 #define SC_WAITN(n)                                     \
00110     ::sc_core::sc_set_location( __FILE__, __LINE__ );   \
00111     ::sc_core::wait(n);                                 \
00112     ::sc_core::sc_set_location( NULL, 0 )
00113 
00114 #define SC_WAIT_UNTIL(expr)                             \
00115   do { SC_WAIT(); } while( !(expr) )

00119 
00120 #define SC_NAMED(...) \
00121   SC_NAMED_IMPL_(__VA_ARGS__)(__VA_ARGS__)
00122 
00123 #if SC_CPLUSPLUS >= 201103L // use uniform initialization in C++11 or later
00124 # define SC_NAMED_IMPL_ONE_(inst) \
00125     inst { SC_STRINGIFY_HELPER_(inst) }
00126 # define SC_NAMED_IMPL_MORE_(inst, ...) \
00127     inst { SC_STRINGIFY_HELPER_(inst), __VA_ARGS__ }
00128 #else // use regular init
00129 # define SC_NAMED_IMPL_ONE_(inst) \
00130     inst ( SC_STRINGIFY_HELPER_(inst) )
00131 # define SC_NAMED_IMPL_MORE_(inst, ...) \
00132     inst ( SC_STRINGIFY_HELPER_(inst), __VA_ARGS__ )
00133 #endif // SC_CPLUSPLUS
